channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 1
item.description:
August 01, 2020 8:13 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, Aug 1.

item.title: August to see warmer, drier weather
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

After a wet June and July, warmer and drier conditions are expected in the first half of this month, said the weatherman.

item.title: 4 new Covid-19 cases linked to transport hub are drivers, interchange staff
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The four new coronavirus cases at Bukit Panjang Integrated Transport Hub are two bus drivers and two interchange staff, said SMRT yesterday.

item.title: 85 people under probe for scams involving $716,000
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The police are investigating 85 people involved in 112 scam cases, where the victims lost more than $716,000.

item.title: 6-year-old Singaporean girl among three imported Covid-19 cases
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A six-year-old Singaporean girl was among three imported Covid-19 cases announced yesterday by the Ministry of Health.

item.title: Piles of trash found along East Coast Park
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Piles of rubbish including plastic snack wrappers, glass bottles and slippers have washed up on the beach at East Coast Park.

item.title: Balestier hotel, gym in Sengkang among spots most visited by Covid-19 cases
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A four-star hotel in Balestier has emerged as one of the spots most frequented by Covid-19 cases in the community, with at least seven visits over a period of 12 days.

item.title: Smoking out illegal cigarette peddlers who lurk online
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Today, you rarely see contraband cigarette peddlers at the usual hot spots in Geylang and Sungei Kadut.

item.title: ST+ news with benefits: Rewards for ST subscribers
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

If you are bored with the usual night-out options, try spending time with friends and family on board a yacht.

item.title: 10 arrested, over 11kg of heroin seized in drug raids
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Drug raids have netted around $800,000 worth of narcotics, including more than 11kg of heroin, and 10 arrests. Those arrested were all Singaporeans - nine men and one woman - aged between 28 and 62.

item.title: Treated patients as brothers
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

KATHERINE LEONG, 49

item.title: Trio fined over power-assisted bikes that were illegally modified
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Three users of illegally modified power-assisted bicycles (PAB) appeared in a district court on Thursday following separate incidents in which the batteries on their vehicles caught fire. No one was injured in these incidents.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Operationally ready national servicemen (NSmen) were called up last month for homeland security operations for the first time since March 31, when all non-essential in-camp training was deferred because of the Covid-19 outbreak. About 580 NSmen from the 735th Battalion Singapore Guards were deployed.

item.title: No hugs, no kisses... for now
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

It has been seven months since Mr Nathanael Tan, 29, has held his sons - who are aged one and three - close.

item.title: Timely eye injections help preserve vision
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Skipping or postponing medical appointments amid the Covid-19 pandemic may be common, but for people with a severe form of age-related macular degeneration (AMD), doing so may lead to vision loss.

item.title: Home owners doing renovations face delays and increase in costs
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Not only has Mr Abdul Hadi's home renovation completion date been delayed by three months, the 31-year-old is now looking at an additional $2,000 to $3,000 in renovation costs.

item.title: Care, generosity and sadness
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

When Singapore General Hospital's Ward 68 nurses found out that migrant workers who were being discharged from the hospital to community care facilities did not have uncontaminated clean clothes to wear, they combed through their own wardrobes to donate clothes to the workers.

item.title: Siblings in Singapore are first known cases of rare genetic disease
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Jamuar syndrome causes developmental delays, epileptic fits, speech impairment and an unsteady gait.

item.title: Manpower issues pose biggest roadblocks for construction firms seeking to resume business amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

With some 300,000 workers in the sector, the task of getting them back to work and keeping outbreaks at bay is a mammoth one.

item.title: A stand-in son or brother
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Cold, white and silent. Patients sedated and hooked up to multiple lifelines. The occasional beeping of machines and call bells

item.title: Zooming in for a clearer picture of Covid-19
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Researchers at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) have been using visualisation software to better understand the molecular structure of the Sars-Cov-2 virus - which causes Covid-19 - along with its key proteins and enzymes.

item.title: A quiet Hari Raya Haji with fewer worshippers at mosques
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Prayers at mosques for Hari Raya Haji yesterday were quieter due to safe distancing measures to curb the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Impressed by Sars 'courage'
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

During the Sars outbreak in 2003, Dr Hoi Shu Yin was a junior nurse in Tan Tock Seng Hospital's Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

item.title: Nurses on Covid-19 front line share their sacrifices and triumphs
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

This Nurses' Day, nurses talk about their experiences battling the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Festive cheer for migrant workers
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Safety coordinator and supervisor Billal Hossein (second from left) sorting out meals prepared for foreign workers at a factory in Sungei Kadut yesterday.

item.title: NSmen return for homeland security ops
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Operationally ready national servicemen (NSmen) were called up for homeland security operations for the first time since March 31, when all non-essential in-camp training was deferred because of the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Traveller with coronavirus 'unlikely' to have got it in transit here
item.description:
August 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Initial investigations have shown that a traveller who tested positive for Covid-19 in South Korea after transiting in Changi Airport was unlikely to have been infected in Singapore, said the authorities yesterday.
